results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Vancouver Motion Pictures, Peter Jones, John Taylor and Don White
results.brief_description: Perhaps because estuaries seem so ordinary, many on the west coast of Canada are being drained to accommodate new housing and industry. This film demonstrates the importance of the estuary; its environmental function, the natural forces that control it, and its particular ecology. Superb microphotography affords unusual shots of tiny creatures hunting and eating their prey. Sound by John Knight. (Five awards, including Toronto; San Antonio)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Vancouver Motion Pictures, Peter Jones, John Taylor and Don White

results.title: Estuaries
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Dietmar Fill
results.brief_description: Micro-photographic study of marine life in estuaries. Shows a great variety of marine animals and plants that thrive in the unique environment of the estuaries, one of the most productive natural systems in the world. Details the lifestyles of the sea horse, semaphore crabs, soldier crabs, prawns, oysters and mangroves.

results.title: Esther
results.brief_description:
Recorded at the Eglise Saint-Germain during the Festival du Marais. ‘Esther’ (1689) is a biblical tragedy complete with musical choral interludes composed by Jean-Baptiste Moreau, who would serve in this same role for Racine’s last play, Athalie. The play shows how Esther, the wife of the Persian king Ahasuerus (Xerxes I), saves the Jews from a massacre plotted by the king’s chief minister, Haman. With its three acts, chorus and transcendent message that God and truth can be made manifest on stage, Esther breaks sharply with Racine’s previous practice in tragedy. It is not one of his major works, despite the beauty of its choruses.” Reference: Encyclopedia Britanica. Online; http://www.eb.com

Credits: Director, Dominique Delouche ; photography, Emanuel Machuel ; music, Jean-Baptiste Moreau.
Cast: Andre Falcon, Liliane Nataf, Julien Bertheau, Claude Brosset.

results.title: Estate of change
results.brief_description: Ascot Vale housing estate was in a state of decay with poorly maintained buildings, not support services and poor and dangerous living conditions. The tenants formed a tenants group which initiated change, maintenance, improvements in living conditions, provided services such as legal aid, migrant classes, a theatre group, milkbar and a community centre. This video shows the change process through interviews with tenants. The second half of the video is the theatre piece performed by the community theatre group.

results.title: Essentials of tap technique
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this delightful performance collaboration, Blumberg highlights the tap skills of dancers Charles ‘Cookie’ Cook, Brenda Bufalino and Kevin Ramsey. Focusing on the performers’ movements from the knee down, Blumberg uses slow motion to isolate such tap techniques as the ‘toe stab,’ ‘flam with pull-back,’ and ‘trenches.’ The syncopated tapping forms a rhythmic counterpart to the dancers’ demonstration of the essentials of their art.

results.title: Essential interview skills: teachers guide (MS)
results.brief_description: This teacher’s guide is designed to accompany the short video, ‘Essential interview skills’, produced to help young people who are preparing for work and/or tertiary entrance. It addresses many common questions such as “What are prospective employers looking for?” and features discussions with employers and universities. The video can be used in a variety of classroom situations such as VET, SOSE, Industry, Enterprise and Technology design studies, home groups, study skills seminar or work experience preparation seminars.

results.title: Essence of life
results.brief_description: Explains and illustrates the main characteristics of a living organism - the ability to reproduce its own species, response to stimuli, movement and metabolism. Studies different forms of life developed on earth as conditions altered, from fresh water to dry land - fish, amphibia, birds, insects, animals and plants.

results.title: Essay writing made easy
results.creator_credit: Deakin University, Dennis Famigia, Ruth Lee and Peter Lane
results.brief_description: James Valentine takes the viewer through the six stages of essay writing: analysing the question; researching; planning; writing; and editing & presentation. Each stage is clearly presented with practical advice from both academics and students. Study guide included.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deakin University, Dennis Famigia, Ruth Lee and Peter Lane

results.title: Espolio
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: A film based on a poem by Earle Birney and a painting by El Greco. The theme concerns the responsibility of the innovator for the thing he makes. In the film, a carpenter builds a cross but is reluctant to become involved in the right or wrong of situations that bring men to die on crosses. His interest is in his own craftsmanship. To illustrate this moral, the filmmaker used light-pen drawings, giving color and emphasis through optical processes.
